item.title: Set 6
item.description: Challenge 41: Implement unpadded message recovery oracle Link Nate Lawson says we should stop calling it “RSA padding” and start calling it “RSA armoring”. Here’s why. Imagine a web application, again with the Javascript encryption, taking RSA-encrypted messages which (again: Javascript) aren’t padded before encryption at all. You can submit an arbitrary RSA blob and the server will return plaintext. But you can’t submit the same message twice: let’s say the server keeps hashes of previous messages for some liveness interval, and that the message has an embedded timestamp: ** {
